title: VICE reporter treks dangerous jungle with migrants. Here's what she saw
description: VICE correspondent Paola Ramos explains why so many vulnerable migrants brave one of the world's most dangerous jungles to reach the US.

title: Sleep doctor tells Anderson Cooper how long a power nap should be
description: Dr. Raj Dasgupta tells Anderson Cooper how to get better sleep and how long a power nap should be. Watch "Full Circle" Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 6p E.T.

title: See 'SNL' cast member's passionate speech on anti-Asian hate
description: "Saturday Night Live" cast member Bowen Yang delivered an emotional speech on anti-Asian violence during the "Weekend Update" segment.

title: This new P&G ad confronts stereotypes against Black Americans
description: P&G, which owns brands like Tide and Old Spice, just launched an ad campaign called "Widen the Screen." It's part of a larger effort by the company to confront racial stereotypes in media and give opportunities to Black creators.

title: CDC director warns of 'impending doom' as US cases spike
description: Much of America's recent progress against Covid-19 has been erased as new infections jump nationwide.

title: Supreme Court leaves in place a ruling blocking Hillary Clinton deposition over private email server
description: The Supreme Court on Monday left in place a lower court order that blocked the conservative group Judicial Watch from deposing former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton about her use of a private email account in a lawsuit related to the 2012 attack on the US consulate in Benghazi, Libya.

title: These ancient Americans mummified parrots. No one knows why
description: Researchers working in northern Chile say people from an ancient civilization transported exotic birds hundreds of miles over the Andes, before mummifying them with their mouths wide open.

title: Vaccine passport apps could help us return to normal. First they need to solve the trust problem
description: The next time you attend a wedding or concert, visit a place of worship, eat indoors at a restaurant or even go to work, you may need to show digital proof of vaccination or negative Covid-19 test results.

title: Dramatic video shows fire at Indonesia oil refinery
description: Nearly a thousand residents have been evacuated and several injured after a fire broke out at the Balongan refinery in West Java on Monday.

title: White House launches task force to keep scientific decisions free from political influence
A Czech billionaire was among five killed in a ski trip helicopter crash
description: Czech billionaire Petr Kellner was one of five people killed when their chopper crashed near a glacier in Alaska during a skiing trip on Saturday.

title: Video shows dislodged ship floating down Suez Canal
description: The ship blocking the Suez Canal has been fully dislodged, a Suez Canal Authority spokesperson told CNN. The Ever Given, a 224,000-ton vessel almost as long as the Empire State Building is tall, ran aground in the Egyptian canal on March 23. Crews from Egypt and around the world have been working nonstop to try to refloat the ship, with the operation involving 10 tug boats, sand dredges and salvage companies.

title: Analysis: Birx's haunting disclosure throws new scrutiny on Trump
description: • NYT: White House to investigate Trump-era 'political influence' on government science

title: Southwest just placed the biggest Boeing 737 Max order since it was grounded
description: Southwest agreed to buy 100 737 Max jets from Boeing, the largest order for the troubled jet since its grounding in 2019 following two fatal crashes.

title: Jason Derulo and girlfriend Jena Frumes are expecting their first child
description: Jason Derulo and his girlfriend, model Jena Frumes, are expecting their first child.

title: Colorized photos show Ireland at the turn of the 20th century
description: Thousands of historical images from across Ireland are being brought to life in color for the first time, thanks to a new AI-led photo project.

title: Ever Given ship mostly freed in the Suez Canal, authority confirms
Video shows stern of ship dislodged from Suez Canal bank
description: The Ever Given ship blocking the Suez Canal has been mostly dislodged as authorities plan to fully refloat it at high tide later, chairman of the Suez Canal Authority said. CNN's Ben Wedeman reports.

title: India sees 6th day of record-high case numbers
Anguish in Myanmar after weekend of 'outrageous' bloodshed
description: Myanmar's military junta chief Min Aung Hlaing threw a lavish dinner party Saturday while his troops reportedly shot dead more than 100 people in the streets and forced thousands of people to flee into neighboring Thailand, during a weekend of indiscriminate terror and bloodshed that was widely condemned internationally.

title: Oil prices dip after ship stuck in Suez Canal is partially freed
description: Oil prices are falling after the Ever Given container ship was partially pried free in the Suez Canal, giving rise to hopes that a crucial lane of global trade can soon reopen.

title: Nashville flash flood leaves four dead and dozens of homes and businesses destroyed
description: The city of Nashville is recovering from a deadly flood caused by heavy rains that prompted hundreds of rescues and killed four people.

title: Lil Nas X releases unofficial 'Satan' Nikes containing human blood
description: Rapper and singer Lil Nas X is launching a controversial pair of "Satan Shoes" featuring a bronze pentagram, an inverted cross and a drop of real human blood.

title: He's a cop. He's 91. And he has no plans to retire
description: Where do you see yourself at the age of 91? Working, with no plans to retire, may not be the first thing that comes to mind.

title: Birx describes 'uncomfortable conversation' with Trump after CNN interview
Arkansas and Tennessee latest US states to pass anti-trans legislation
description: LGBTQ advocates are warning that the influx of anti-transgender legislation being proposed in many states nationwide could have significant negative repercussions for trans youth.

title: Philippine fighters fly over Chinese flotilla in South China Sea
description: The Philippine military is sending light fighter aircraft to fly over hundreds of Chinese vessels in disputed waters in the South China Sea, its defense minister said, as he repeated his demand the flotilla be withdrawn immediately.

title: Slum golf: A whole new ball game on Mumbai's streets
description: You can play golf on pristine green courses. You can even play on a course made of ice.

title: How the internet has redefined protest in Myanmar
description: Myanmar has seen widespread protests since a military coup overthrew the government in February. CNN looks at how protesters have been using social media as a tool to coordinate, a tactic inspired by other campaigns including Hong Kong's pro-democracy movement.

title: This California theme park is set to reopen, but there's a catch
description: Disneyland and Universal Studios are among the California theme parks that are set to reopen under strict Covid-19 guidelines. At Six Flags Magic Mountain in Los Angeles, attendance will be limited to 15% capacity, and reservations are limited to California residents. CNN's Paul Vercammen reports.

title: Blinken suggests US won't take punitive action against China over coronavirus outbreak
Biden's infrastructure plan is about to put his bipartisan appeal to the test
description: With some wind in his sails from the massively popular Covid relief package, President Joe Biden's next big legislative push -- a sweeping infrastructure plan -- is set to bring a far more challenging bipartisan test in the coming weeks.
